page.title: 02BIRDS IN BENWELL
page.content: Around {Benwell}the most {common} {birds}are pigeons and sparrows. As well as wild pigeons some people keep them to race. Sparrows are all wild and can always be seen around houses and gardens. Other common birds are the blackbird and starling.The tree sparrow is the smallest one of our sparrows and it nests in holes in trees. The chaffinch is a regular character around Benwell.It nests in the trees.To the west of our school is some open space and an old park with large trees.Sometimes the {kestrel} hovers over the open space looking for small mammals. Recently magpies have been seen darting among the trees in the park.To the east of the school a pond in the new nature park attracts a number of gulls. When the school yard is quiet and empty, pied wagtails often land there and look for insects.
